column1: back of a length, slanting in towards off stump. Goes back and chops to short third man
fuller now, flat on off stump, gets on the front foot to clip into the midwicket region
back of a length outside off, goes deep in his crease and whips it to long-on
a bit of flight on off stump. Goes down low to sweep but doesn't quite get over the ball. Thick top edge flies over the keeper, just to his left
flat, angling into the pads, goes back and clips to midwicket
tossed up outside off, stretches out to defend towards point
full, slanting away from off stump and providing a bit of width. Gets on the front foot to ease a drive through cover point
back of a length close to off stump, drops it into the cover region with soft hands and calls his partner through for a quick single
length ball angling across to off and middle. Stays on the back foot and defends into the covers
a touch short on leg stump, pulled to the left of deep square leg
full on off stump, driven crisply to the right of short extra-cover, where White makes an excellent one-handed diving stop
back of a length, slanting away from off stump, carries at shoulder height to Ludeman after Carey slashes and misses
length ball on off stump, punched back firmly but straight to the bowler
back of a length, not too much width. Stops on him slightly as he looks to cut, and he chops it down to the left of backward point, without too much power
back of a length on middle stump, makes a bit of room and punches to the sweeper on the cover point boundary
full on off stump, driven hard down the ground but mid-on is nice and straight and the ball goes straight to him

bowled him! Right up there, not quite yorker length but full enough, and Weatherald plays across the line, looking for the big whip through midwicket. He misses, Tremain hits middle stump. A great start for the Renegades
back of a length on middle stump, clipped to the left of mid-on
back of a length on off stump, maybe a hint of movement back into Head. Defended back to the bowler
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away to the left of midwicket
back of a length on off stump. Tries to make room and slash through the covers with an angled bat. Extra bounce beats his edge
full on off and middle, and he clears his front leg and brings his bat down straight and firm to nutmeg the bowler in his follow-through. That was hit really hard
fullish on off stump, clears his front leg again and flat-bats it straight, this time between the non-striker and mid-off
shortish, a bit of width, slapped to deep point
fullish on middle stump, makes a bit of room to drive to the right of mid-off
back of a length on off stump, jabbed to backward point
and again. Fullish on middle stump, Head plays a checked drive to mid-off
length ball on leg stump, whipped towards midwicket, who's right on the edge of the 30-yard circle

ooh, nearly. Digs this in short, and the angle from over the wicket gives Carey just a hint of width. Gets on his toes and slashes at the ball, deliberately slicing under it.  Bravo, leaping to his right at full stretch, only gets a fingertip to the ball at short third man
length ball on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
slower ball on off stump, opens his bat face and dabs towards Pollard at short third man
another slower ball, very full and wide of off stump. Goes a little early at the slash and fails to connect
length ball wide of off stump. Reaches out for an angled-bat drive and gets an inside-edge that rolls down to Ludeman, who falls to his right to stop it
slower ball, back of a length, turning like an offbreak from leg to middle. Goes back and tucks it gently into the midwicket region
low full-toss on off and middle, and that's a little unfortunate for Carey. Smashes it back down the ground, hard, and smacks the stumps at the other end
slower ball, fullish on off stump. Gets on the front foot and swipes it to the left of long-on
flat, angling into the pads from round the wicket, clipped to midwicket
goes back to a length ball angling into off stump, makes a bit of room and slaps to deep point
shortish outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
flat, skids through quick as he goes back to try and pull. Goes with the angle and his his pad, outside leg stump
that angle again, into off stump. Can't manufacture enough width to force this past backward point
a touch short this time, goes back to pull to deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room and dabs towards backward point

smack! Head can really hit them over that leg side, and he gets a pretty decent ball, just short of a good length, on off stump, and he swivels through his hips to smash that over the midwicket boundary
length ball on off stump, punched hard to short extra-cover
back of a length, slants away from off stump to give Head just a bit of width, and he steps deep in his crease to cut it hard to the right of backward point
short and wide once more, this time he slashes it squarer, to the man at deep point
length ball angling to leg stump from wide of the crease. Punched to short extra-cover
short outside off, wrong'un that slightly stops on the batsman, goes back and punches to long-off

tossed up wide of off stump, and Carey puts it away well. Not the easiest shot to play, against the turn from outside off stump with a long-on and a deep midwicket on the rope, but he slog-sweeps and hits the gap
a bit flatter, and he goes down on one knee in a flash to slog-sweep flat, on the bounce, to deep midwicket

dropped. A bit of dip outside off stump for Hogg as he comes forward to drive with a slightly open face, and then some turn to find the outside edge. Went quickly to the keeper and it bounced out of his gloves
wrong'un, goes back and doesn't seem to have picked it. Hurries through an attempted flick but can't make contact, hits him on the thigh pad

that's a rubbish long-hop, but it stops on the pitch and barely reaches the batsman - it might have bounced twice before reaching the keeper had he left it. Aims a pull at the ball and manages to drag it down to long-on off the toe-end
fullish, wide of off stump. Was looking to make himself room in advance, and ends up too far from the ball to make any contact with his slash
shot. A slower ball on middle and leg, and he quickly opens up at the hips and clubs it into the gap between long-on and deep midwicket
nicely timed, but straight to the fielder! Full again, wide of off, and Carey middles his drive over the off side, but picks out the man sweeping on the cover boundary
back of a length outside off, chopped down to third man
shortish slower ball outside off, chops his attempted cut into the ground, to the right of backward point
back of a length on off stump, stays leg-side of the ball and punches to deep point
loopy full-toss wide of off stump, driven to sweeper cover
tossed up full on middle and off, looks to drive to long-on, I think, ends up bringing more bottom hand into it than he'd like and hits it to midwicket instead
slow, flighted ball outside off, sweeps powerfully along the ground to the right of deep square leg and the fielder does well to move quickly and stop it at the boundary
tossed up wide of off, swept to the left of deep midwicket

cleverly bowled. Similar line to the two previous deliveries, but Hogg slows this down just a touch. Through his sweep too early and doesn't connect. They go up to the third umpire to check for the stumping, but he hasn't dragged his foot out of the crease at all

back of a length, wrong'un. Looks to go back and punch down the ground, without picking the ball out of the bowler's hand, and the sudden turn into his pads forces him to jam his bat down and flick to midwicket instead
slower ball, full on off stump, gets on the front foot for a checked push to long-off
another slower ball. On the pads this time and Ingram clips to deep midwicket
very full, wide of off stump, flat-batted to long-off
short, wide, full-pace ball, cuts it straight to backward point

slower ball, back of a length. This is the offcutter, spinning away from the left-hander, and he steps back and across and brings his bottom hand to play to half-pull, half-whip that to the backward square leg boundary. Super shot
full on off stump, driven to short extra-cover

short, straightens towards off stump. Again it doesn't come on to the bat. Goes on the back foot and flat-bats it back towards the bowler, on the bounce. He gets his hands to it but can't hold on. They scamper one as the ball rolls into the mid-off region
floated up outside off, and that's a super shot. The flat, hard sweep, and he bisects deep backward square leg and deep midwicket
and again, smashed into that same gap between deep backward square leg and deep midwicket. This time it's a short ball, and he swivels quickly through a pull
tossed up slow on middle stump, driven to long-on
slow, flighted ball on off stump, and now Head puts Hogg away. Down on one knee, slightly open at the hips, and slog-sweeps just beyond the rope to the right of deep midwicket
full again, wider outside off, swiped to the left of long-on
slower ball wide of off stump, too wide for Ingram to attempt a shot
fullish, slanting across the left-hander, flat-batted firmly but straight to extra-cover
full on off stump, driven to the right of long-off
fullish on off stump, driven to long-off. This one's the straight-bat drive. Head went with an angled bat and lot of bottom hand the previous ball
extremely wide yorker, reaches out but can't connect, and the umpire signals wide
slower ball slanting away from off stump, and that's halfway deliberate. A wristy slice to find the gap to the right of short third man
fullish, wide of off stump, flat-batted to long-off
shortish, skids through at just over stump height and doesn't miss off stump by much after beating Ingram's attempted pull
slowish yorker outside off, whipped down to long-on
oh my. Looks to bowl the slower one, I think, and lets slip a hip-high full-toss outside off. Signalled no-ball after the batsman slashes and misses

nicely bowled. A very slow slower one slanting away from off stump. Ingram begins his slog too early, stops his bat-swing, and tries to make up for the slowness of the ball with a flick of his wrist, but can't connect
fullish outside off, eased to deep point
in the blockhole on off stump, jabbed down to long-on
again, very full, just outside off. Clears his front leg to play a wristy drive to long-off
down the track and Pollard spots him coming. Slants one wide of his off stump. Brings his bottom hand into play to swipe that to long-on
and Head smacks him over cover first ball. Full and wide of off stump and he flat-bats that hard over the man at extra-cover
back of a length offcutter wide of off stump - very, very wide of off stump, and the umpire signals wide after Head has a slash at it
full on off stump, clears his front leg to jab it down to long-on and bring up his fifty
fullish slower ball close to off stump, swiped down to long-on
full outside off, driven back powerfully and makes the non-striker jump to protect himself, but only gets one for it - long-off is nice and straight
short slower one angling away from off stump, chopped to short third man
full and wide of off stump, reaches out to drive towards long-off. Doesn't really middle it, and perhaps that allows the batsmen the time to turn around and sprint back for a second
slower ball tight on the stumps, slanting from middle and leg to off stump. Makes a bit of room and chops into the point region
full-pace yorker on off stump, stabbed to extra-cover
another attempted yorker, on leg stump. Not quite as full as he'd like, and he clears his front leg and whips to the left of deep midwicket
slower ball, full, on off stump, swiped to the right of deep midwicket
dipping full ball on leg stump, clipped down to long-on
slower ball, 88kph, on middle stump, quite full. Swipes across the line towards deep backward square leg
full on off stump, goes back and clears his front leg to whip that to deep midwicket
short outside off, and Ingram's bottom hand does its magic again. Steps back and across and just swats that over the midwicket boundary. Bam.

shot! That's a full-toss angling across to off stump - which is pretty much towards the batsman as he leans across, shaping for the scoop over short fine-leg. Was that over waist high? Not called no-ball, but in any case, he uses his wrists and flips that into the gap to the left of short fine leg

Colin Ingram's bottom wrist is just sensational. A length ball, slower ball, on off stump. He whips it across the angle, manufactures all the power himself, and clears the midwicket boundary with a hard, flat flick. Wow
full outside off, driven away to deep cover
in the blockhole on off stump. Clears his front leg to create swinging room and smashes it hard down the ground. Hits the stumps at the other end and rolls away towards deep midwicket
full and outside off, by a fair distance, the left-hander goes for a slog and misses altogether
deflects off the bottom edge as he charges down the pitch and a very wide ball that he does well to turn into a full toss ends up crashing into the stumps. The things we see in a T20...
full and outside off, drives to long-off
slower ball which Ingram tries to reverse swat to the third man boundary. Can't touch this.
full and outside leg, he swings hard, but can't get to it again
gets under a length ball, at his usual pace, and launches it out to the square leg boundary. Sensational shot. Bottom hand and bat speed.

again! Over midwicket. And this one's even longer! It's length again, and it's off-pace. Ingram sets up in power position, right leg out of the way, left leg braced on the ground. And then out comes the big swing of the bat.
walks at the bowler to nudge a good length ball on off stump to deep midwicket
gets across his stumps, which Bravo spots, and bowls short and down leg. Wells manages to pull it to long leg
yorker, at 137 kph, aimed at the toes of the right-hander. Wells deflects it to long leg
good yorker, but it's been called wide for being few inches outside leg stump. Only reason it didn't hit Ingram's feet is because he had moved across his stumps looking for a big hit
into the crowd at midwicket as he meets a low full toss with the fiercest of whips

takes it on the second attempt, and in trying to do so, he lands on his left shoulder. White is the man, almost bumbling a straightforward chance after Ingram backs away but is denied pace from the bowler
walks all the way across his stumps - giving a free sight of it - and sweeps it short fine leg. Hogg has to juggle it a couple of times before taking it
length ball slanting across to off stump, clipped away through midwicket
full, slanting into a fourth-stump line. Shuffles across to clip to mid-on
length ball on leg stump, clipped to deep square leg
fullish, swinging away outside off stump. There's a slip in place, but the edge flies wide of him as Ludeman drives hard at it, away from his body
full on middle stump, clipped to mid-on
back of a length on off stump, shuffles across to work it through square leg
full outside off, driven crisply but straight to cover point
back of a length on off stump, opens his bat face to dab to backward point
shortish on off stump, gets on his toes for a jab to the left of mid-on

yorker, angling into the batsman's feet. Just about jams his bat down in time and gets a thick inside edge that rolls into the leg side. Just saw a replay. It missed his inside edge and hit his back pad. Impact well outside leg stump, though
back of a length on off stump, opens his bat face and dabs towards backward point
back of a length outside off, opens his bat face to guide it down to third man
Shot! That's full on off stump and he brings his wrists into play for a gorgeous drive to the left of mid-on
fullish on middle stump. This time it isn't elegant, just swipes across the line to send it rolling away to the right of deep square leg
short outside off, leans back and cuts to third man
length ball angling across to off stump, clipped to the left of midwicket
fullish on middle stump, whipped away to the right of deep square leg
slower ball, pitching outside leg. Mild lbw appeal after he misses the flick and the ball ricochets off pad into the point region
shot. A length ball slanting away from off stump, and Harris opens his bat face and slices it away over backward point. Excellent quick hands
length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
short on off stump, pulled downwards with a nice turn of the wrists, but straight to midwicket
length ball on off stump, clipped to the left of midwicket
back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers
short on leg stump, and he skips away from leg stump, makes himself room, and uppercuts it over the keeper. The Renegades are off to a bit of a flier here
shortish, wide of off, carved to backward point. He'll be disappointed he hit it straight to the fielder
back of a length close to off stump, gets on his toes to defend to backward point
length ball outside off, and Siddle has struck. Ludeman goes for a angled-bat drive through the covers and only manages a thin edge through to Carey
back of a length outside off, shuffles across and jabs to the left of backward point
in the blockhole outside off. Harris clips it back to the bowler

length ball on leg stump and Harris whips it high in the air, into the gap between deep midwicket and deep square leg. Drops down four-fifths of the way to the boundary and Lehmann, running to his left from deep midwicket, can't quite reach it on the slide
back of a length outside off, chopped down to backward point
full on off stump, clipped to midwicket
slower length ball close to off stump, presses forward and dabs to backward point with an open bat face
back of a length on off stump, gets back and across and blocks it back to the bowler. Hurried through to White with a bit of extra bounce
once again, back of a length and tight on off stump. Punched back to the bowler
a bit more width and White cuts it hard, into the ground. Bounces over backward point's head and he does well to stretch overhead and get his hands to it
Tossed up wide of off stump, reaches out to drive and slices it to the right of backward point
quick legbreak outside off and White, pressing forward, plays down the wrong line in defence
wrong'un. White sees the initial line and gets down quickly for a reverse-swat towards backward point
back of a length outside off. Looks to whip it to long-on but Rashid dives to his left to cut it off
back of a length, sliding away with the angle outside off, chopped towards short third man
googly outside off, White plays another controlled reverse-sweep to backward point
yorker on middle stump, clipped to long-on
another yorker, just outside off, opens his bat face to stab to point
full outside off, swiped to deep square leg
down the track, looking to make himself some room. Siddle follows him with a low full-toss angling into his feet. Manages to ease a drive to the left of long-off
yorker on off and middle, jabbed to backward point
full-toss wide of off stump, carved in the air, to the left of third man
full on off stump, whipped to deep midwicket
shot! Length ball on middle stump, and he hammers that sweep so hard. straight to the man at deep square leg, though
full on middle stump, clipped to long-on
flighted ball wide of off, swept hard, along the floor, to deep midwicket
Now Harris looks to sweep from off stump, only manages a bottom edge that trickles down to short fine leg
googly wide of off stump, that's too short to reverse-sweep, and he can't connect. Went for the shot looking at the line, but he would have been a lot better served trying to cut that.

all those quiet overs have produced that shot, and this wicket. This is a length ball angling across to off stump, and he slogs across it, against the angle, and only manages a top-edge. Climbs high into the sky and the keeper Carey, sprinting to his right and throwing himself flat on the ground, takes an excellent catch

ooh. Shuffles across his stumps, and perhaps spotting that Stanlake fires a fullish ball, aiming at leg stump. Ends up sending it down the leg side, but White definitely did expose his stumps with that shuffle
fullish on off stump, shuffles across again to clip to deep square leg
full outside off, driven to short extra-cover
bouncer outside off, Cooper thinks about having a slash, ends up leaving it
back of a length outside off, punched to deep point
shortish, wide of off, slapped to deep point
inswinging yorker on off stump, stabbed to short extra-cover
full, close to off stump, flat-batted to long-off
another inswinging yorker, on leg stump this time, jabbed down to long-off
length ball on off stump, shuffles across to clip to deep midwicket
another yorker, right at the batsman's feet. Jams his bat down to dig it out into the mid-on region
slower ball, back of a length, on middle stump. Looks to make room, punches straight to short extra-cover
low full-toss on off stump, clipped to deep midwicket
back of a length, skids on towards off stump, goes back to whip to deep midwicket
slower short ball outside off, pulled to deep midwicket
Ah, here's one. A length ball angling into off stump and Cooper walks across and scoops it away, over short fine leg

slower bouncer over middle stump, and suddenly the Renegades have two fours in two balls. Hooks it away without getting too much power on it, but the placement is good, too far to the right of deep square leg for the fielder to be able to pull it back with the dive

bowled him! He knows White has been trying to sweep him whenever he can, and he bowls a flat, good-length googly, but holds the pace back a bit. White swings across it too early and the ball pegs back off stump
quickish legbreak on middle stump, defended back down the pitch
back of a length on off stump, clipped gently towards deep midwicket and they scamper two
googly turning into middle stump. Pollard presses forward and clips with the turn to the left of short fine leg
shortish, wide of off, quick turn to beat the attempted cut
short outside off but it's the googly, not much turn but enough to cut down the width Cooper has to cut. Chops it to the right of backward point

length ball, slower ball, outside off, and Cooper mishits it for six! Was he really looking to hit that over long-on? I'm not sure. I think he was looking to hit over mid-off, but he's into it early, doesn't really get all of it, but it just about carries over the rope, to the left of the fielder on the boundary

Ooh, there's an appeal for a run-out here. Direct hit, and they've gone to the third umpire, but a big stretch from the big man and Pollard is home, just about. A clip into the midwicket region, and they chanced a second run as Neser chased right from long-on and made a sliding stop. Excellent throw
yorker, and he's just missed off stump as Cooper's walked all around the crease and missed an attempted reverse-scoop
low full-toss outside off, flat-batted into the deep to the right of sweeper cover
back of a length, angling across to off stump, pulled to deep midwicket
high full-toss, I think just over waist height, and it's at Pollard's hip. Just gets enough bat on it to tuck it down to the fine leg boundary
yorker on middle and leg, clipped to long-on and it takes its time getting to the fielder, allowing the batsmen to pick up another two

back of a length close to off stump, Cooper looks for the pull, and he ends up getting a top-edge that shoots up nearly vertically. Carey, behind the stumps, only has to move a couple of steps to his left to take the catch
short outside off, skids through. A little late on the pull and he hits it on the bounce to mid-off, off the high part of the bat
full now, angling into leg stump, whipped away through square leg
back of a length outside off, clubbed to long-on

ooh, what a shot! If he meant it. Aims for the off-stump yorker and he makes himself room and carves at it. Was possibly looking to hit through point, ends up finding the gap to the left of short third man
shortish ball over off stump, sneaks below Bravo's bat as he swivels through an attempted pull. Probably beat him for pace too - that was 151kph
fullish on off and middle, clipped towards deep midwicket

tossed up wide of off, Bravo looks to launch that over long-off, and the dip and turn makes him slice it squarer than intended. All of that is just the precursor to a TRULY ASTONISHING CATCH. Laughlin sprints to his left from long-off, catches it when he's running at full tilt, headed towards the rope. He sends a back-hand flick back into the field of play just as he jumps over, and Jake Weatherald, coming the other way from sweeper cover, has to complete it by throwing himself to his left because Laughlin has flicked it flat and hard and a long way infield. Weatherald grabs it with both hands, at full stretch
tossed up wide of off, this time it's fuller and he lofts it just beyond the reach of Laughlin flinging himself to his left after sprinting from long-off
back of a length on off stump, whipped away to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, chopped to backward point

flighted ball on leg stump, and Hodge has swept him for six over deep square leg. The man on the boundary is the tallest man on the field, Billy Stanklake, but even he can't catch that, despite adding a few more feet to the equation with a  jump and a stretch

slower ball on the stumps, and Pollard goes after it - he has to - and picks out deep midwicket. Probably wanted to hit it to the fielder's left, but there's a bit of offcut on the ball and it causes him to hit it squarer than he'd have liked to
full outswinger wide of off, driven to the right of deep point
slower short ball wide of off, signalled wide after Hodge lets it go
fullish outside off, swiped down to long-on
fullish outswinger outside off. Looks to open his bat face and run it down to third man and it swings past his edge
full outside off, whipped to long-on
fullish outswinger wide of off, sliced in the air but it bounces short of the man coming in off the cover point boundary
in the blockhole on off stump, jabbed back to the bowler
full outside off, flat-batted to long-off
full outside off, looks for a big heave and gets a thick edge that loops up and bounces out of reach of the short third man fielder turning around and running back towards the boundary

slower ball, full, looks to slog it away and only ends up hitting it back to the bowler in his follow-through. The ball either bounced on the ground, very close to his bat, or straight up off his left foot. They're checking with the third umpire and it's bounced on the ground, so it isn't a c&b. Siddle also missed the stumps at the keeper's end with the batsman quite a way out of his ground
yorker outside off, slapped straight to extra-cover
very full again, heaved to deep midwicket
slower short ball, and Wildermuth has swatted that down the throat of deep square leg coming in off the boundary
slower full ball wide of off stump, Hodge slashes and misses
inswinging yorker, goes late and into the pads. No appeal because it was going down leg. Misses the flick and the ball ricochets off pad into the off side
that late outswing again. A full-toss outside off and he slaps it to the right of sweeper cover
in the blockhole, just outside off, squeezed to the left of extra-cover
high full-toss on off stump, immediately signalled no-ball. Opens up and looks to hoick it away. Hits him on the glove (?) and rolls into the point region

the bails start flashing as he does Hodge in with a slower, outswinging yorker. Plays all around it, but it's a free-hit, and the ball hits off stump and runs away to the third man boundary. Maybe a thin edge on it too - the umpire doesn't signal byes
wide yorker, jabbed to the left of extra-cover
yorker angling down leg. The batsman was looking to make room, and it squeezes between his legs as he misses a flick and rolls down to the keeper
full-toss on leg stump, and Hodge has smashed this into the third tier beyond deep backward square leg. Was this over waist height too?
wide yorker, Hodge can't connect with the open-faced stab
full outside off, and Hodge lifts it over extra-cover and picks up another four
another full-toss, angling into leg stump, Hodge opens up and whips it away for another six over deep square leg
